text: We see an early incarnation of a MACHINE (this will be th inner brain of the FABRICATION MACHINE). We see the scientist, in a white coat.

We pull back to see the Scientist is playing a complicate MULTI-LEVEL 3-D chess game on a MULTI-LEVEL GAME BOARD wi the MACHINE. The Scientist makes an elaborate multi-level move. The Machine reaches an arm out into the chess game then malfunctions and strews the game everywhere.
We pull back further to see the back and legs of the DICTATOR, with black-uniformed soldiers flanking him. The regime's emblem can be seen on the uniforms.
Useless.
Please.   Give it a chance.
We're on the machine, which is clicking and jerking as it malfunctions.
One more.      That's all. We turns to leave. We hear the clicking of boots as the soldiers accompany him out.
We see the scientist's dejected face as he comes towards camera to turn it off.
The grainy footage rolls again; we see the scientist movi away from the camera (having just turned it on).

The lab is shadowy, late at night. We see his worktable f the first time, covered with discarded sketches, a furiou filled-in journal, and pieces of failed machinery (the fl is also similarly littered). The TALISMAN sits on the worktable. Nearby is a small old-fashioned tiny little bo
(tired, but dictating to keep the documentary record complete) My last possible solution.... (muttering to himself) It must work...
He gently brushes his fingers over the little box as thou for good luck. He picks the TALISMAN up off the table. He moves over to insert the talisman into the port of the machine.
His back to us, he faces the machine. We see him putting something over his face (but only from behind).
There is a sudden FLASH OF GREEN LIGHT and the machine JO and then suddenly, starts up...lighting up, electricity crackling, parts moving in smooth coordination, etc.
The scientist waits, watching. The machine continues to r Its arms move smoothly, almost curiously.
The scientist puts the device covering his face down and up and comes towards camera.
We see the camera's POV as the scientist comes towards us CLOSE on the scientist's face, which is exhausted, cheeks sunken, eyes wide, pupils dilated.
Pull back to show the machine purring, suddenly full of a sort of energy. Something new has happened.
The scientist switches off the camera and:
The machine zips through the complex 3-D chess game at lightning speed, checkmating the scientist in seconds as Dictator watches. The scientist laughs fondly and pats the machine.
Perfect.
(PROUDLY) You see, it evolves.
The scientist proudly gives the machine to the dictator. flash goes off: someone is taking a picture O.S.
The dictator exits; we hear the click of boots and see as much as possible of the soldiers flanking him.

head_text.subj: OUT OF SIGHT OF THE SCIENTIST,

text: CLOSE on the machine: the dictator is gripping it with a nasty firmness. The machine seems to try to squirm away. The director's BLACK-GLOVED HAND grasps it harder.

he machine, responding to the brutality, lashes an arm ou and grabs the nearest soldier (seen from the back, we see only the uniform and helmeted head) by the back of his ar BREAKING his ARM. The soldier falls (if possible).
he dictator CONTINUES ON WITHOUT BREAKING STRIDE.
CHILLINGLY) Yes. Perfect.
And we:
SEQ. 010 - Title Sequence
(robotic sounding) Alert. We are in a state of emergency...
Sounds of WAR: EXPLOSIONS, MACHINE GUNS, SCREAMS...

A tiny, cluttered attic, filled with bits and pieces of f material--burlap, door hinges, an old shoe, old eyeglasse rusty scissors, pen nibs, gas masks etc.   We see the tin little box sitting on the cluttered makeshift worktable.
...the Machines have become uncontrollable... they are shooting at will... ALERT: stay in your homes.
Grainy footage as we see the scientist looking around desperately--he's obviously in hiding.
(HEARTBROKEN) My invention... my beauty... beauty was taken...
He is feverishly cobbling together a SMALL BURLAP DOLL.
He labels the burlap doll on its back: "1." He makes fran notes in a journal. He brushes his fingers over the littl box for good luck, then moves towards a strange contrapti on the table.
LASHES and EXPLOSIONS shake the workshop horribly.
Reports are coming in... they've breached the Northern walls of the city...
The radio voice is DROWNED OUT BY EXPLOSIONS. D
An announcement from our Chancellor!
(on the radio) Comrades, I have lost control. The Machine is now our enemy. We need to join forces to fight against it.
We hear EXPLOSIONS and SCREAMS outside.
We see the scientist cobbling together another SMALL BURL DOLL, a little more evolved.
He labels it "5," then makes notes in a journal.
his voice a mere whisper NOW) Five so far....I can't get them right...
(through static) Gas masks are being distributed... ALERT: beware....
We see the scientist desperately grabbing bits and scraps one last doll. He is like a skeleton, almost no energy le
ADIO (V.O.) (cont'd) ...deadly gas....
he radio voice dies out.   We hear nothing but STATIC.
The scientist totters over, makes a note in his journal. clutches the little box, and suspends this last doll with rope in a strange contraption.
a feeble whisper) My last one... this one, finally, must work... it must....
The SOUND of the scientist collapsing to the floor.
SEQ. 020 - Attic
The thin strand of rope stretches... stretches... and
The rope SNAPS, and--
--a SMALL BURLAP FIGURE falls onto the table.
As he falls, he is yanked free from a large, circular Machine.
e had been attached with the fraying rope and a long cabl attached to him by the TALISMAN. The cable still dangles from the Machine, but the force of his fall pulls the Talisman off.
The little burlap figure pulls himself to his feet, shaki his head. Falling free from the connecting cable has fina awakened him.
e is made up of odd patchwork items: burlap, a thick zipp big round gas-mask eyes (which we recognize as what we sa before, in the title sequence).
We pull around to see the number "9" painted on his back.
We pull back further to see...
..he is on the tabletop in the RUINS OF A SMALL ROOM.
Splintered BITS OF WALL jut up to the open sky. Rotted FLOORBOARDS are BENT and WARPED. The room is full of year of DUST and ROT. Dust hangs in the feeble rays of dirty sunlight.
The table and floor are covered with the same kinds of sc and raw materials from which "9" is made: burlap, hinges, bits of Machinery.
9" blinks and turns around, his head darting this way and that, trying to make sense of his surroundings.
He walks over to the edge of the tabletop. He peers over, sees...
...the SCIENTIST LYING DEAD ON THE FLOOR.
lumped on the floor, we clearly see: the scientist's skeletal hand is clutching a tiny box.
He hears a clattering sound and turns to see
loose window shutter. He goes over to the window.
e pushes opens the window to see--
usting machine carcasses, bombed-out ruins, and emptiness stretch as far as he can see.
Terrible, life-ending destruction.
here is no other living being anywhere.
9 stares in disbelief and horror and fear. He can't make sense of it... or the room... or the endless miles of lifeless wasteland stretching out in front of him.
e seems to be completely alone.
sees a glint of something, a possible sign of life.    He moves to go outside.
He stops and is strangely drawn to the TALISMAN. He turns and takes it, stowing it inside his zippered chest before heads out.
SEQ. 029 - 9 Meets 2
9 moves warily in the dusty, grim light, along the desert RUINS of the outside streets. It is the remains of war.
Pulverized HULKS of BUILDINGS, torn-open suitcases, scatt clothes, rusting cars and the grim debris of human civilization surround him.
He sees a dead body slouched next to a suitcase in the fr seat of a car.
Banners hang on the buildings with a three prong symbol o them.
achines lie deserted on the sides of roads.
Distracted by the spectacle, 9 stumbles and lands on a ra old flyer: REVOLT!    He looks back at the War Machines a Dictator flags.    He sees a vandalized poster of what ap to be a dictator/leader.
9 looks around him, trying to piece together what happene Suddenly there is a clanking sound in front of him.
9 sees a light flicker on in the shattered hulk of a war Machine.
LOSE on 9 as the light crosses his face.
Scared, he ducks behind a huge piece of debris.   9 grabs piece of metal lying in front of him.
The shadow moves closer, 9 shakes nervously. The figure emerges with spear in hand and 9 swings the weapon at him with all his might.
9 hits him square in the chest. It is another ragdoll: 2. is propelled backwards and falls to the ground on the deb behind him. 9 quickly tries to hide.
But 2 is looking at 9 with surprise.   He struggles to ge 2
speaking with urgency to 9.
(firmly, kindly, almost eagerly; like trying to soothe a wild animal) Wait... I am a friend.
(GENTLY) Friend... I am a friend.

9 now sees he has hit a ragdoll, similar to himself. He hesitates, not sure what to make of this. 2 extends his hand, calmly, eagerly. 9 hesitates again, then, still tim but showing a little bravery, drops his weapon and goes t help 2 up.

We see that 2 is much older, much more decrepit, much mor primitively constructed: he is made from patchwork bits o OLD LEATHER SHOES. A SHOELACE stitches up his front and i tied in a bow at his neck. Bits of leather FRAY off him. His feet are primitive small HINGES. Half of a pair of eyeglasses, like an enormous MONOCLE, is attached to 2's
9 helps straighten 2's monocle. 2 smiles at him. We see that 2 is like a wise mentor, a kindly professor with a contagious eagerness and imaginativeness.
2 peers eagerly at 9.   He circles 9 and spots the number his back.
(eagerly, excited, like an intrigued scholar) Yes... yes... I always thought there'd be one more.
He nods and smiles. He extends his hand to shake 9's hand While doing this, he takes 9's hand and studies it, noddi with eager excitement. We see that 9's hand is more sophisticated than 2's.
The details... how exciting. (FASCINATED) Carved wood... steel bolts... molded copper...
2 turns slightly, and 9 sees his number and tries to say But no sound comes out of his mouth.
looks at him, nodding, again, the kind mentor. He's interested, observing without judging; curious, kindly an ready to help.
You can't speak.
With a friendly, disarming smile, he taps 9's zipper. 9 unzips himself and 2 peers in. 2 looks up, happy that he help.
Yes, yes...
2 looks around nervously and hurries over to his roller-s cart covered with detritus - odds and ends, a broken chin doll.
...come with me.
follows, looking around curiously.
2 finds the china doll.
Here!
As 2 rummages through the chest of the china doll 9 picks a bullet casing from 2's cart and starts tapping it. 2 tu with the doll's voice box in his hand.
(sees 9 with the bullet; whispers sharply) No! Stop!
2 eases the bullet away from 9, then smiles gently at 9,
( QUIETLY) Some things in this world are better left where they lie.
e puts the bullet to one side and kneels, prying into 9's chest. 2 begins to connect the doll's voice box.
But if you know where to look, these ruins are full of riches.
2 concentrates, a look of pleasure on his face as he twis few more wires. Static and unclear sound come out at firs but as 2 tunes the voice further...
9 (as his voice is "tuned in".. starting with pure static, then slowly moving into a voice) Chhhhhhh.....chhhhehhhh...
2 Wait.. (tunes him in) ...almost there...
9 gets a little panicky look on his face at the strange sounds coming out of him. 2 puts a calm hand on his shoulder. 9 calms down and tries again.
9 Friend?   Friend?
2 (BEAMING) Friend.
9 (more and more normal SOUNDING) Are we alone?
2 (REASSURING) No. There are others.
and 2 stare at each other. 9 looks at 2 in wonderment, then reaches out and touches 2's chest where he hit it.
2 beams at 9, happy 9 can speak, happy he was able to hel and happy that 9, with his first words, is concerned abou others.
glow beams from within 9's chest.   2 stares.   9 removes TALISMAN from his chest.
2 has a big reaction--he draws his breath in and looks at in ASTONISHMENT.
He takes it and looks at it.     He gives 9 a look of sur
But how strange.... muttering to himself as he turns the Talisman in his hands) Yes, he was always drawing this... exactly like this... how strange...
hey both stare at the TALISMAN.
Suddenly, a  is heard OFFSCREEN. 2 looks up IN HORROR. He grabs his spear. He pushes 9 away almost fiercely.
(firmly, to 9) GO!
SEQ. 030 - Cat Beast Attacks
2 points forcefully to an old rusted can.
2 runs into the can. stands, ready to attack.
9 watches 2, wondering what is coming. Then from behind h a large claw of a mechanical figure settles softly next t 9's can. He tries to call out to 2...
And from behind 2 enters--
t is a nail and razor-studded predatory Machine with a ca skull-shaped head, its body laced with bones, nails and razors. 9 now understands 2 was trying to protect him.
GASPS as he turns and sees it. The Cat Beast lets out a roar and claws at 2, KNOCKING him over and losing his spe
looks on with horror.
2 attempts to reach for his spear but the Beast holds him down with its razor-sharp feet.
The Beast is attracted to the Talisman. It picks it up wi one of its jagged claws and looks at it quizzically.
cringes.    His movement makes his hiding place teeter, creaking.

he Cat Beast WHIRLS at the sound. Picking up 2's struggli body, the Cat Beast stalks towards the noise, right up to hiding place, sniffing through its hollow nostrils. 9 cringes in terror. The Cat Beast probes with one of his claws INTO the tin can. 9 recoils. The claws do not find him and retreat. 9 is relieved.
A beat, then:
9 feels himself violently LIFTED UP and SMASHED.
We see the Cat Beast has picked up the entire tin can and smashing it to get at what's inside it.   Failing, it hur the tin can aside.
9 is almost knocked out. Trying to stay conscious, he struggles towards the entrance of the can.

is POV: through his haze and through the broken edges of opening to the can, he sees the Cat Beast GRAB the Talism and the struggling 2 in his sharp-toothed mouth, and disappearing into the smoky mist.
9 can just make out, in the distance, the silhouettes of
(MUTTERING) The others...
POV SPYGLASS: the spyglass searches through the city and comes across a lone staggering figure (9).
W
Pull back to show the back of 5's head as he peers throug the spyglass, then pulls away so we can see into the spyg again.   We zoom in through the spyglass to a
CLOSE SHOT on 9--
9 staggers, weary, and collapses.
In the foreground, the feet of another ragdoll (5) step i the shot.
Seq. 040 - Meeting 5
5 is finishing sewing 9 up.
It's all right. You're safe now.
9 Where am I?
5 With us.
(MUTTERING) Yes... he told me there were others...
5 (suddenly, urgently) Who?
(still dazed, trying to REMEMBER) He was older... Out there...
5 2.  Out in the emptiness? HORRIFIED) Alone? Was he all right? hen is he coming back?
I
( T
9 looks at him, the whole memory suddenly coming back to as though fresh.
HE--THE-- can't think of the right
T hing! It took him.
5 reacts with horror.
5 No...   No!       It can't be!
He turns away, grief-stricken.
Keeping secrets from me, I see.

Another RAGDOLL pushes into the workroom. This is a bigge ragdoll, the most primitive one we have seen. He has primitive wooden hinges for feet. He is very frayed and patched together. The number 1 is painted on his back.
and 9 whirl around.       5 CRINGES.
5 I... I was coming to tell you...

1 carries himself with authority. He wears a red cloak, a a strange mother of pearl and wire hat bound together as almost papal-like headpiece, and carries a staff made fro old gear, with a bell attached.
pulls at 9 with his staff, displaying the number on his back.
1 hat's this?
turns and glares at 5 like a general glaring at a new private, expecting an explanation for a misdeed. 5 cringe back, obviously intimidated by 1.
5 ... I found him.... in the emptiness.   He saw--
1 HOOKS 5 by the neck with his staff, cutting off his spe
1 What? What were you doing out there?
Y
5 I saw him from the watchtower and I thought...
ou'll lead The Beast straight back to us! How many times have I told you?
The Beast--that's what took 2!   If we hurry we could save him--
1 (CURTLY) If the Beast took him, that's the end of it.
9 But he was still alive--
5 turns with sudden hope to 9.   2 might still be alive?
1 No, we have RULES.
1 smashes his staff against the ground.
Immediately, a knife comes through the curtain revealing another RAGDOLL: a large ragdoll, with the number "8" on arm.
(TO 8) Our new guest seems confused. (condescendingly, to 9) Perhaps I can help you achieve some clarity.
8 is very large, and designed for great strength. He is almost as evolved in his design as 9, but his design favo primarily brute force.

He has armored himself with curved pieces of tin and meta He carries the blade of a large kitchen knife, with a nai has attached for a handle. On his back he has slung anoth knife--half of a scissors; the scissors handle loops up a his head.
1 leaves. 8 taps his knife in his hand and motions for 9 5 to follow.  They follow.
SEQ. 050 - Clock Tower
They walk through the nave and plane up overhead.
5 taps 9 covertly.
5 (whispering, hopefully) He was still alive? Really?
9 I think so--
8 looms forward threateningly.
8 Hmmmph!
5 quickly stops talking.   9, following his lead, stops talking also.
The group gets into a bucket-like device.   8 pushes 9 ha into the bucket.

NODS commandingly to 8. 8 begins to crank a rope that lifts them up. 5 gestures to 9 to hold on. 9 braces himself as 8 pulls them up into a tall tower. He steals a glance at 1. 1 frowns. 9 tries to smile.
hey pass an old plane outside that has crash-landed in to the Cathedral.
On the side wall is a round, multi-colored stained glass window. Shafts of different colored sunlight flicker through.
he bucket moves past two large church bells into--
...the inside of a CLOCK TOWER of a once-magnificent Cathedral. We see the BACK of the CLOCK, the light castin shadows of the backward numbers onto the floor.
1 gestures out towards the outside and addresses 9:
When we woke in this world....
Camera drifts up to the clock... WIPE to WHITE...
SEQ. 053 - War Flashback
ENTER FLASHBACK:  as we see the chaotic inferno of war.
(V.O.) (cont'd) ...it was chaos... Man and Machine attacked each other with fire and metal... The earth split and the skies burned...

Ragdolls 2, 5, 6, 8, and 1 hide under an old helmet, frantically trying to escape the explosions BURSTING arou them. 7 appears with 3 and 4. We get the sense that 7 is the reckless one, the only one determined to SCOUT AROUND see what's out there.
(TO 1) I found others...
They are welcomed in by the other dolls. They turn to 1, is clearly the leader, to see what to do next. 1 decides: points forward, and they all run a few feet while underne the helmet.
A plane crashes in the background, causing 5 to fall behi (he has both eyes).
hrough a dirty MIST we see War Machines enter with their weapons.
A RESISTANCE FIGHTER throws a Molotov cocktail at one of Machines. It turns and SHOOTS a round of gunfire.
A MUSTARD GAS BOMB is launched from the top of the Machin It heads straight at 5 but he runs and gets KNOCKED to th ground, barely missing it.
he bomb lets out a yellow CLOUD that envelops the area an KILLS PLANTS ON CONTACT.
7 turns and sees 5 lying face-down on the ground.   1 urg her to stay with the others.

But, again, brave and slightly reckless, she runs through yellow cloud to help him. She brings him back to the grou His left eye is damaged. The others cower. 2, the gentle mentor of the group, puts a comforting hand on 5's damage eye. 7, always the scout, brave and fearless, points off the right, and addresses 1.   She knows what's out there; she's seen it.
(TO 1) There's a path ahead--
1 looks around calculatingly, like Patton: the general ta charge. He thinks, judiciously, then:
1 (TO 7) Go ahead.
nods and darts off.      1 turns to the others, who wait their instructions.
(to the others) Follow me.
They hurry off, increasingly enveloped by the YELLOW CLOU
The yellow CLOUD TRANSITIONS into STEAM...
(V.O.) (cont'd) The gas killed everything.
SEQ. 057 - 9 Meets 6
The steam is rising from the small thurible in the CLOCK TOWER.
I led us here...
1 is now standing at the thurible with a torch in his han
1 (V.O.) (cont'd) ...to sanctuary. And here we waited for the war to end.
T
He puts his hand around 9's shoulders and walks him over the other side of the room.
Slowly, the world became silent.
1 and 9 walk over to a picture of the Cat Beast hanging o the wall.
The only thing that remains now is the Beast.
1 faces 9 as the torch slowly fades.
So we stay hidden and we wait for it, too, to sleep.
he torch burns out. 9 looks at 1.
But where did it come from?   Why is it hunting us?
1 Questions like that are pointless. We need to protect ourselves. Keep ourselves out of danger.
But one of us is in trouble... he could still be rescued...
1 turns and walks to a tattered calendar page on the wall with the days 3, 4, and 7 crossed off.
1 oo many of us have already been lost.
1 crosses 2's number off the calendar with the burnt end his torch.
No! You're not listening. He may still be alive! Why won't you try to save him? Why won't you--
1 angrily SMACKS HIS STAFF ON THE FLOOR.
1 Enough! Enough of this madness! (to 5, annoyed) Go to the watch tower and take our guest with you.
5 meekly immediately obeys, gesturing to 9 to follow him.

We hear a strange WHISPERING SOUND, and CAMERA, instead o following 5 and 9, stays behind and moves in on a shadowy little area. There, we see 6. 6 is ink-stained and has a strange quality, as though he sees and hears things insid his head that only he experiences. He has a SMALL SKELETO KEY around his neck, and his fingers are made of PEN NIBS He is drawing on a piece of paper and WHISPERING TO HIMSE
6 muttering, whispering) The source.... The source...
We see he is drawing the TALISMAN. In fact his whole area covered with drawings of the TALISMAN.
SEQ. 060 - Telescope
rom a high angle we see the nave of the Cathedral. It has been bombed and attacked, and there is a plane intersecti through the side.
The Camera moves to the left and what seems like a prow o boat comes into frame. We find ourselves in...

2 had created a sort of LOOKOUT. A rickety, jury-rigged spyglass points out of a hole in the wall. A half-drawn m is pinned up next to the spyglass. Everything is pieced together from the sorts of bits and pieces we saw 2 scavenging. Around the space, we also see more bits and pieces that 2 has found out in the wilderness.
sighs sadly.       He touches the spyglass sadly.
5 This was the first thing we built together. looking around at the map, bits and pieces, etc.) All his work... trying to make sense of everything.
He looks out into the wilderness.
Is he out there? Is he still alive?
9 Yes.       He could be.
looks out in fear. We see the conflict on his face: fear of going out there but a desperate longing to see his old friend again.
(conspiratorially; looking around to make sure they're not being spied ON) We could go after him.
(shocked; and amazed, this is impossible) Us?
No one else will. imploring him) We MUST go.
5 is silent, afraid.
9 looks through the spyglass.
POV spyglass: the THREE TALL SHAPES in the distance.
Look. That's where the creature took him. Out towards those three tall shapes.
5 (HORRIFIED) Ohhhh... no... we can't... not there. We need to stay here. (as though repeating something he's heard from 1) We have rules.
looks at him.    He recognizes 1's words.
QUIETLY) Why do you listen to 1?
5 looks at 9.
(repeating what he's been indoctrinated with) A group must have a leader.
9 looks at him for a beat.
9 (GENTLY) But what if the leader is wrong?
5 looks a little shocked. He never thought of this. We se in 5's face that he is considering 9's question, but he s can't bring himself to disobey 1.
5 hesitates again.      9 sees he is having an effect on
(suddenly, firmly) I'm going. I'm going to look for him.
He turns to 5.
(COAXING) Come with me. I can't do it alone.
is terribly torn. He wants to, but he's never done anything like this before. He's always done as he's told. He hesitates:
5 (HESITATING) I... I...
(he can't odo 'd) he can't 5(c nt it, DEFY 1) I can't.
9 looks directly into his eyes. He knows how 5 loved and admired his mentor and everything he did. He understands that 5 would like to be like 2, to do what 2 would have d
(GENTLY) But wouldn't he have come for you?
9 waits, hopefully. But 5 looks away. He wants to do it, but he doesn't have the nerve. 9 nods, compassionately. H turns away. 5 hesitates, looking down, then:
5 (more determined) Wait!
5 grabs the map off the wall and rolls it up.   He walks towards 9.
You're going to need a map.
9 and 5 smile at each other.
SEQ. 070 - Wasteland
9 and 5 look behind them at the Cathedral as they start t make their journey to find 2.

5 and 9 pick their way through the rubble. They have traveled miles from the Cathedral. Mist swirls in front o them, obscuring their path. 5 and 9 look around constantly, on the alert for the Cat Beast. Piles of rusted, broken metal machines, broken skeletal bones, exploded vehicles tipped into craters, an crumbling, disintegrating buildings surround them.
9 looks up and 5 follows his gaze to 2's STAFF stuck in a pile of rubble atop a hill.
5 hurries up the hill. 9 follows him. 5 turns to FIND 2's hat lying in the dirt. He bends down to pick it up, brush the dust off the top. 5 looks sadly at 2's broken hat.
(QUIETLY) You looked out for him?
5 (SIMPLY) He looked out for me.    He taught me.
he spoon-light falls off.      5's face is filled with gr
Why was he out here alone?
He slumps.    9 puts his hand on 5's shoulder, reassuring
9 We can still find him.
e stands up, determinedly. 5 hesitates, but then, his fac filling with hope, gets up too. 5 puts 2's hat on his quiver. 9 offers 2's staff to 5 but 5 gestures to 9 for h to hold it.
They continue on, through the debris and devastation. storm is starting to come up. The wind howls loudly.
5 (BITTERLY) Why was he out here alone?
A good question.
(RUEFULLY) Yes. The ones we're not supposed to ask.
They exchange a look. This is the first time 5 has said something to actually challenge 1's rules. 9 notices this and nods.
W
The wind howls louder. 5 looks at his map uncertainly and tries to keep leading them forward.
They come to a field full of trip mines and dangerous tan trap pits.   A parachute blows in the wind on a tree bran
5 turns the map one way and the other with growing panic.
9 here are we?
5 (MISERABLY) I don't know...
As he turns the map to look at it, the wind picks up and blows the map out of 5's hands. It blows away into the distance and gets stuck on a pole.
5 reaches after it desperately but can't retrieve it. looks in despair at 9.
It's no use.      We should go back!
We can't.
9 looks around bravely, then points over towards a trench
There.
They head over to the trench.      They now see a huge FO OF THE BEAST.
They inspect the footprints. 9 moves bravely towards the trench entrance. 5 resists, afraid.
No... it's too dark.
9 looks around.
9 We can use that.
e points to a lightbulb in a broken headlight.
SEQ. 075 - Trench
9 is pointing to the lightbulb.
can't help himself. He pulls the lightbulb out, pulls out a battery and electrical wire from his chest, winds the w around the battery and places it inside the hat.
They screw the lightbulb and it LIGHTS UP.    5 can't hel 9 smiling at 9.
unwinds the wire holding the blade on 2's staff. He place 2's hat on the end of 2's staff and secures it with the blade.   5 nods, intrigued.
5 Yes... yes... good....
He sees that 9 now has made a LIGHTSTAFF.    He blurts ou
2 will be so impressed!
A terrible grief suddenly comes over him as he remembers has happened to 2.
puts his hand on 5's shoulder, bracing him.
9 (FIRMLY) Yes. He will.
9 is conveying with his simple words that he believes 2 I still alive and he WILL be impressed when he sees the lightstaff.
9 shines the light to gesture "this way."
5 smiles tremulously at 9, almost more grateful for his sympathy and support than necessarily believing him. He follows 9 to the mouth of the trench.
The camera pans over to reveal catlike scratchmarks on a wall indicating this is the same trench we saw the Cat Be travel through earlier.
5 recoils, but 9 puts a calming hand on him again, then p both hands on the lightstaff and enters the trench. 5 tak a deep breath and follows.
9 and 5 continue down the trench, both looking around wit great caution and nervousness.
s they come around a corner they see--
The CAT BEAST.
